info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 23 at 7:41AM PST until December 27 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches likely. For the Winter Storm Watch above 1500 feet, periods of moderate to heavy snow likely. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches at lower elevations between 1500 and 2000 feet to as much as to 30 inches is possible between 2000 and 3500 foot elevations. * WHERE...Jackson County. For the advisory, the Union Creek, Prospect, and Butte Falls areas. For the Winter Storm Watch, all areas above 1500 foot elevations including portions of Highway 62 from Shady Cove to Prospect, much of the Applegate Valley, Jacksonville, from east Medford south to the Ashland area in the Rogue Valley, and Highway 140 east of White City. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are likely to drop to around 1500 feet, at times, during periods of moderate to heavy precipitation on Christmas Eve into Christmas Day. There is growing confidence that snow levels will fall further with greater accumulation and impacts on the 26th and 27th. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
